FuncDef:
The active port-mode-channel command activates the licenses for channelized sub-interfaces on a device.
The undo active port-mode-channel command deactivates the licenses for channelized sub-interfaces on a device.
By default, the licenses for channelized sub-interfaces are not activated.
CLIs: undo active port-mode-channel slot <slotid> card <cardid> [ port <port-list> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a subcard ID.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 4294967295.

Specifies a list of sub-interfaces for which the licenses are to be deactivated on a specific subcard.
The value is a string of 1 to 255 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the slot ID of a board.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Examples: [~HUAWEI-license] undo active  port-mode-channel slot 1 card 7 port 1
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Before enabling channelization on a sub-interface, you need to run the active port-mode-channel command to activate the license for the channelized sub-interface. To deactivate the license for a channelized sub-interface, run the undo active port-mode-channel command. You can deactivate a specified license or the licenses for all the channelized sub-interfaces on a subcard or main interface.
There is no need to activate the license for a channelized sub-interface on a GE interface.
Prerequisites
Before deactivating the license for a channelized sub-interface, ensure that channelization has been disabled on the sub-interface using the undo mode channel enable command.
